file_content.text: First you must face the demon in its lair, then descend upon the Sand People. Only then will your path become clear.
Ah, Sith, you made it. The hostiles outside were no match for you, I see.
They tried to stop me. They failed.
Of course not.
Failure can be contagious, and hard to dispel once contracted.
Sorry if I tracked blood in on your floor.
It got messy.
This world is an hourglass, ever being turned. The sands wipe away all traces of the past.
Let's just get down to business.
Cut to the chase.
To do the business you are about, one must indeed sink very low.
You are the seeker Sharack spoke of. You wish to understand the Jedi's purpose in the lair of the sand demon?
I'm used to getting what I want.
Now.
The spoiled child often becomes lazy.
That's right.
My eyes may be aged and failing, but my mind sees.
I came for the scintillating conversation.
I don't want idle chatter.
When the suns are bright, everything scintillates on Tatooine.
Please, Izzeebowe, make haste. Tell my friend what you know. I will remain here after to hear your wisdom.
Fine. Gather close. Few are aware that Tatooine was once a place of positive Force energy. Jedi made pilgrimages here to renew and purify.
The sands speak of a ritual called the Demon's Blood. This is likely what the Jedi that Sharack witnessed was engaged in.
Explain this ritual.
The Demon's Blood?
I don't want suspicions, I want facts.
You better be sure.
Everything is fiction, shaped by the teller's perspective.
Get on with it.
Breath does not come as easily for the aged, dark one.
The Demon's Blood: A Jedi seeking enlightenment would cover himself in fresh sand demon blood and enter the village of the savage ones.
Cowering before the demon slayer, the savage ones would reveal the path to self-discovery and to that which the slayer seeks.
According to Sharack, the Padawan did not slay the beast.
No demon slain.
Do you mean the Sand People?
Who are the savage ones?
Tatooine makes most who come here savage, and the Sand People have been here all along.
This sounds like a children's fable.
Nonsense.
We are all children, my friend. Even at my age.
Izzeebowe, as I told you, the girl faced the beast but left it unwounded.
There must be another way to bathe in the beast's blood, but you will have to discover that for yourself. If you care to.
To know where this Jedi girl went, you will have to perform the ritual yourself, and then see if the savage ones speak.
It's not much to go on, but it will do.
Fine.
That is everything I have. If everything is not much, then perhaps nothing is everything.
I appreciate your help and insights.
Thank you.
Step lightly on my desert. It has been through so much in its life.
If I don't find satisfaction, it will be your blood I bathe in.
This better work or else.
Satisfaction, of any kind, in the Tatooine desert is likely an illusion.
Here are the coordinates you will need. After you face the sand demon, I will meet you at the Sand People compound.
If the legend is true, and the Sand People have something to offer you, I wish to see it with my own eyes.
The world is weeping. And the tears evaporate in the heat of our sins.
I think you mean from the heat of our suns, Izzeebowe.
No, child. There is a dark presence newly arrived on Tatooine.
